front.div:
A Glycophorin is a sialoglycoprotein of the membrane of a red blood cell. It is a membrane-spanning
protein and carries sugar molecules. It is heavily glycosylated (60%). Glycophorins are rich in sialic acid,
which gives the red cells a very hydrophilic-charged coat. This enables them to circulate without adhering to
other cells or vessel walls.
